model.util

Class DialogBoxes

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.util.DialogBoxes

  • public class DialogBoxes
extends java.lang.Object
    This is a utility class that opens the game dialog boxes
    See Also:
    ViewController, StatisticsController, EditorController, FileController

    • Method Detail

      • customUtilityDialog

        public static javafx.scene.control.Dialog customUtilityDialog(java.lang.String title,
                                                              java.lang.String optionalHeader,
                                                              javafx.scene.layout.GridPane gp,
                                                              javafx.stage.Stage owner)
        Returns a dialog box with the given title and sets the given gridpane as content. Padding and spacing is added before the dialog is returned If optionalHeader is equal to "" or null, a header will not be created The returned dialog does not contain buttons, and these have to added before showAndWait() is called. Failure to do so will result in a non-closeable, blocking dialog.
        Parameters:
        title - The title of the dialog box
        optionalHeader - An optional header string
        gp - The content of the dialog box
        owner - The Stage that "owns" the dialog box
        Returns:
        The dialog box

      • openAlertDialog

        public static void openAlertDialog(javafx.scene.control.Alert.AlertType type,
                                   java.lang.String title,
                                   java.lang.String headerText,
                                   java.lang.String contentText)
        This static method shows a dialog box and is useful for presenting errors to the user
        Parameters:
        type - The Alert.AlertType of the Dialog box
        title - The title of the Dialog box
        headerText - The header text of the Dialog box
        contentText - The content text of the Dialog box

      • openOptionsDialog

        public javafx.scene.paint.Color[] openOptionsDialog(ViewController vCtrl,
                                                    javafx.stage.Stage owner)
        This method opens an options dialog box where the user can set colors for the game.
        Parameters:
        vCtrl - ViewController object to get the colors from.
        owner - The Stage that owns the new dialog box.
        Returns:
        The array of colors.
